poem:
Title: "Broken And Mended"

A pact assembled, 
late on a crimson parliamentary evening -
stemming from the roots  
of the tired, years-long deadlock.
In its heart,
the silent migrant's plea - 
a mariner's song blurred 
by the spray of sea.
History, a plate once shattered,
now pieced together,
in the warm fold of uncertainty, 
and the quiet applause of the undetermined.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘History made’ as EU parliament passes major migration and asylum reforms – as it happened 6.01pm BST Summary of the day The European parliament approved the bloc’s new migration and asylum pact. The pact was passed despite earlier uncertainties over whether all parts of it would receive sufficient backing. The votes came after years of deadlock, debates and negotiations over the EU’s migration and asylum policies. The pact’s approval was met with a mix response.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
